The posts, for example this one which has been shared more than 800 times since it was uploaded to Facebook January 28, 2019, share a photograph of the empty motorway.

The caption says in Hindi: “This is not Sweden, Switzerland or any European nation. This is India. This is national highway number 66 on the Mumbai-Goa route. My country is changing. All thanks to national hero Narendra Modi.”
Below is a screenshot of the misleading post:

A reverse image search traced the photograph used in the misleading post back to an October 2, 2018 post on the Civil Engineering Discoveries Facebook page, which has more than seven million followers.
The post’s caption is: “Mersin Antalya Highways !! Turkey” followed by two heart-eye emoji.

An Indian website which debunks misinformation, Altnews.in, fact checked the misleading Facebook post and said that the image was actually of the D400 Mersin-Antalya highway in Turkey, and linked to a September 20, 2017 YouTube video.
AFP translated the video’s title into English: ‘Antalya Mersin Anamur Mellec Viaduct’.
A search on Google Maps for ‘Antalya Mersin Anamur Mellec Viaduct' found the D400 Mersin-Antalya highway.
The Google maps satellite image matches the one in the Facebook post.
